questions.question: Each of the four boys …………………… clever.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each and every.

questions.question: Neither of them …………………… there.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each either and neither.

questions.question: …………………… books are lost.
questions.description: Possessives are Group A determiners. They cannot go before Group B determiners (all, some, any, either, neither etc.)

questions.question: The two brothers quarreled with ……………………….
questions.description: Each other is used to talk about two people or things.

questions.question: John and …………………… are friends.
questions.description: Pronouns used as subjects should be in their subject form.

questions.question: Rahul and I …………………… cousins.
questions.description: When the subject is made up of two or more singular nouns, the verb should be plural.

questions.question: None of us …………………….. seen him.
questions.description: Singular verbs are more common after none.

questions.question: Every light …………………… out.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after every.

questions.question: That boy of ……………………… has broken my window again.
